Description: Study for the painting 'The Departure of the Israelites for Egypt' (Birmingham Museums and Art Gallery); an imaginary scene with a complex of Egyptian temples stacked upon one another, to left in the foreground, figures seated and standing in rows, to right, figures leaving on camels and donkeys, with cattle. 1827 Pen and grey-purple ink, with watercolour
Curator's comments: The painting was first exhibited at the Society of British Artists in 1829. Moon, Boys and Graves published a print after this painting in 1832 by John P Quilley (1870-1-8-2817, placed British XIXc Plan Press).
Exhibition history: 1969, BM, 'Royal Academy Draughtsmen 1769-1969', no.287 1986/7 Nov-Jan, London, Barbican Art Gallery, 'David Roberts', no. 113 1994 Aug-Nov, Edinburgh, Scottish NPG, Visions of the Ottoman Empire (no cat.) 1996 Sept-Nov, Edinburgh, Scottish NPG, 'David Roberts' (no cat.)
Acquisition notes: This item has an uncertain or incomplete provenance for the years 1933-45. The British Museum welcomes information and assistance in the investigation and clarification of the provenance of all works during that era.
